channel.title: CVE Feed for Melapress -- all
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Melapress -- all products

item.title: CVE-2023-6506|2024-08-02T08:35:13.232Z -- melapress -- wp%202fa%20%E2%80%93%20two-factor%20authentication%20for%20wordpress
item.description: The WP 2FA – Two-factor authentication for WordPress plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Insecure Direct Object Reference in all versions up to, and including, 2.5.0 via the send_backup_codes_email due to missing validation on a user controlled key. This makes it possible for subscriber-level attackers to email arbitrary users on the site.

item.title: CVE-2023-6520|2024-08-02T08:35:14.473Z -- melapress -- wp%202fa%20%E2%80%93%20two-factor%20authentication%20for%20wordpress
item.description: The WP 2FA – Two-factor authentication for WordPress plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Cross-Site Request Forgery in all versions up to, and including, 2.5.0. This is due to missing or incorrect nonce validation on the send_backup_codes_email function. This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to send emails with arbitrary content to registered users via a forged request granted they can trick a site administrator or other registered user into performing an action such as clicking on a link. While a nonce check is present, it is only executed if a nonce is set. By omitting a nonce from the request, the check can be bypassed.

item.title: CVE-2024-32568|2024-08-02T02:13:40.070Z -- melapress -- wp%202fa
item.description: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting') vulnerability in Melapress WP 2FA allows Reflected XSS.This issue affects WP 2FA: from n/a through 2.6.2.

item.title: CVE-2024-32568|2024-07-23T17:20:34.421Z -- melapress -- wp%202fa
item.description: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting') vulnerability in Melapress WP 2FA allows Reflected XSS.This issue affects WP 2FA: from n/a through 2.6.2.

item.title: CVE-2024-35650|2024-06-10T17:03:08.459Z -- melapress -- melapress%20login%20security
item.description: Improper Control of Filename for Include/Require Statement in PHP Program ('PHP Remote File Inclusion') vulnerability in Melapress MelaPress Login Security allows PHP Remote File Inclusion.This issue affects MelaPress Login Security: from n/a through 1.3.0.

item.title: CVE-2024-32568|2024-04-18T09:49:39.787Z -- melapress -- wp%202fa
item.description: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting') vulnerability in Melapress WP 2FA allows Reflected XSS.This issue affects WP 2FA: from n/a through 2.6.2.

item.title: CVE-2024-1717|2024-06-04T18:01:05.686Z -- melapress -- admin%20notices%20manager
item.description: The Admin Notices Manager plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to unauthorized access of data due to a missing capability check on the handle_ajax_call() function in all versions up to, and including, 1.4.0. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with subscriber-level access and above, to retrieve a list of registered user emails.

item.title: CVE-2023-50905|2024-02-29T05:35:14.761Z -- melapress -- wp%20activity%20log
item.description: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting') vulnerability in Melapress WP Activity Log allows Stored XSS.This issue affects WP Activity Log: from n/a through 4.6.1.

item.title: CVE-2024-1717|2024-08-01T18:48:21.978Z -- melapress -- admin%20notices%20manager
item.description: The Admin Notices Manager plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to unauthorized access of data due to a missing capability check on the handle_ajax_call() function in all versions up to, and including, 1.4.0. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with subscriber-level access and above, to retrieve a list of registered user emails.
